location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Summaries of official secret despatches from the Government of India, the Government of Bombay, HM Minister to Persia, and HM Consul at Tehran

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 135; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.Condition: the file consists of bundles of loose leaf sections held together with silk tap; please handle and turn the pages carefully.

mods.abstract: The file consists of summaries of official secret despatches from the Government of India, the Government of Bombay, and British diplomatic and consular representatives to Persia, relating to Afghanistan, Nepal, Kelat, Herat, Aden, Kashmir, Muscat, Pegu, Turkey, and Kabul. Topics include the Slave Trade in the Persian Gulf, Dost Muhammad [Dost Mohammad Khan, Amir of Afghanistan], a treaty with Dost Muhammad, and the Anglo-Persian War (1856-1857).The date range gives the creation date of the summaries, but the summaries themselves refer to correspondence of an earlier date.
